result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nokomis M Day

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nokomis M Day in court.  Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court for Nokomis M Day.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing scheduled for January 31, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 10.18.22

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Nokomis M Day in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Plea Questionnaire & Addendum to the Plea Questionnaire
Received and Filed, Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 7/25/22 @ 10:30a
